alert.note: Alert for Meigs (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 11 at 4:01PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A band of heavier rainfall impacting portions of southeastern Meigs, Mason, Cabell, northwestern Mingo, Putnam, northwestern Kanawha, Lincoln, Wirt, northwestern Logan, Jackson, southeastern Wayne and Wood Counties through 500 PM EST... At 359 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking heavy rain along a line extending from Racine to 9 miles northeast of Hode. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD....Heavy rainfall of up to inch per hour. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Flooding of urban, low lying and other poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Parkersburg, Nitro, Belpre, Point Pleasant, Ripley, Winfield, Hamlin, Racine, Forked Run State Park, Jefferson, St. Albans, Vienna, Dunbar, Hurricane, Ravenswood, Sissonville, Milton, New Haven, Eleanor and Buffalo. This includes the following highways... Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 115 and 184. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 22 and 51. Route 119 between mile markers 66 and 67. Route 50 in West Virginia between mile markers 3 and 13. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Also watch for hydroplaning and low visibility Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause elevated levels on small creeks and streams, and ponding of water in urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses, as well as other poor drainage areas and low lying spots. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to travel across flooded roads. Find alternate routes. It takes only a few inches of swiftly flowing water to carry vehicles away.
